reviews.text:
Tickets was not given physically...There was not forest check post at the entrance...The forest guard was just fooling around us... saying that tickets will be sent to your WhatsApp number. The collected amount was 500per/person and guide fee is 500(Demanded 1000 first later convenienced for 500). Donno what type of scam was around. The amount which is collected by tourist is going to Karnataka Forest Department..
Place is very good and relaxing, refreshing... The only thing was disturbing was about forest guard... No such official boards were hanged by Forest Department..

This place does not exist. I got fooled around by the Gmap location. I found this banner in the exact location.

Don't waste your time with this. There were few home stay arranging trekking as a part of the package. Not sure if this is the falls. Please research thoroughly before going here

You have to walk around 4 km trekk it's little difficult but there comes the beauty at the end of it really awesome water fall.....once you jump in to this water fall all your tiredness will run away it's a heavenly feeling really awesome better to take forest guard permission they will charge some fees per head if they catch you later then they will loot you saying fine and all

Incredible and spectacular view of waterfall. Easy trek for adults, but do not recommend for small kids or old aged. there is a well laid trail. Easy to navigate. The views are breathtaking and mindblowing. A good place to recharge yourself and disconnect from the fast moving urban lifestyle.

However there maybe some hooligans who create a rucus and create a disturbance for people visiting. some people remove their clothes not considering the fact that there and women and kids around. Sad to see many people disposing waste and wrappers here.

It’s an amazing, not so popular falls. The trek is quite tricky at some points but is scenic as you surrounded by dense green cover. But the view at the foot of the falls is beautiful.

Need to take permission from the forest officials at Hebri and also need to pay an entry fees of 350 bucks which we thought was a lot but later thought it was worth for the serene views we got to experience.

places_with_reviews.name: Jogigundi Falls
places_with_reviews.address: F4P5+634, Jogi Gundi Entrance, Agumbe, Karnataka 577411, India

reviews.text:
My college friends and I visited a waterfall in February and hiked a nice path. However, the waterfall wasn't very impressive at that time. I later asked a friend when the best time to see the waterfall was, and they recommended the monsoon season.
Also, there is an entry ticket of ₹100 per person which is to be bought thete itself.

Nice place to visit during and after monsoons. You will not find water if you visit the place in any other season.

An easy hike of 15-20 mins from parking will take you to this place. Be prepared for leeches if you visit during monsoon.

There is an entry fee of 100 per person. The place is maintained neatly so try not to litter around.

Entry fees :- 200 rs which is expensive
.
One of the worst falls I ever visited, 200 entry fees with zero fun u can’t get down in to the water bcz it’s very deep and strictly prohibited plus few people have drowned here and it’s not falls more like pond 🥲 it has some strange vibes.

The waterfall got its name from the saint Jogi who used to meditate at this place. The unique feature of this waterfall is the point of origin. Unlike traditional waterfalls, the Jogi Gundi fall originates from a cave and running through a hill. The water from this stream merges into Malapahaari River, a tributary of the Tungabhadra. The surroundings of the falls capture the great natural beauty and it’s an ideal place to spend a couple of hours. It is possible to get into the falls and swim in the pond. It is one of the popular places to visit in Agumbe.
.
Imp instructions:-
.
1.  Carry food and water.
2. This place has some strange vibe
3. Best time to visit is monsoon season .
4. Bcz few people drowned here so swimming is strictly prohibited.
5. And this pond very deep and I have strong feeling that ammonia will be there bcz there is no flow to this pond .

I liked the Place & Atmosphere. I was unable to step into the water because of the heavy flow. Before going to this place I've read in someone's review that there are Cobra's & be careful. But  there were many Leech & me & my four friends also attacked with Leech Multiple places in our Body. Better not to visit with Children.

The waterfall looks amazing!
Initially you've to pay 100 rupees as the entry fees and then you have to walk for around 1kms to reach the falls
The water was too much and swimming is not recommended (depending on the water flow)
Over-all a nice view to sooth your eyes!

One of the nicest place to visit. You can experience the magic of pleasing nature. Driving is quite challenging due to lots of hairpins. The road ends at Kundadri view point which is a very nice and beautiful place. Food, snacks, drinks etc are not available at the view point. Also we have to come back before 18:00 hr (there is check post like setup on the way). Parking space is available. There was no crowd when we visited there. And surprisingly there is no entry fee to visit this view point.

Very nice place.
I went by bicycle. Very nice place, it was a bit cold going up.
Great Destination for someone who wants to visit Rainforest and another better option for someone who wants to see Sunset with beautiful Forest Horizons.

Best route for bikers. The view is just breathtaking.
Must try if you love riding.
One of the best place to visit from mangalore for 1 day

I travelled from Udupi to Shivamogga on 25th December evening around 6:10 PM. It took me more than a hour to climb Agumbe ghat due to a unexpected traffic jam because of an accident and a few vehicle breakdown. Otherwise this route is very scenic and fun to drive.

A great spot for clear sunset views at around 6-6:15 pm, but since it's a popular sunset point, arriving 15 minutes early, maybe around 5:45 pm, is advisable to secure a good viewing spot.

I visited during mg Christmas holiday’s.

People tend to leave after sunset, but there's a beautiful view with different shades of orange and red in the sky post-sunset. It was a beautiful experience.

And there's a nearby lake where you can go boating, and the cost is 100 rupees per person. However, I didn't feel it was worth it, so I didn't try it.

Recommend for sunset enthusiasts!

The Aagumbe Sunset Viewpoint is one fantastic point created on the main highway between Udupi and Chikmagalur. It is located right across one of the hairpin bends on the highway. Though being in one corner, there is quite a possibility to be missed.

A stand-like structure created right in the ghats gives a perfect view of the mountains. Watching the lush green mountains extending to what seems like infinity with the clouds wandering above them is impressive and pleasing. For some taller ranges, you could also see that the clouds engulfed the mountain entirely at the peak.

For tourists who visit, this is one of the most famous hotspots for clicking pictures. A small garden is also created at a walkable distance from the viewpoint where you can take a break and relax. You can also stroll around the garden if you want. Overall, the sunset point is fantastic, giving you a breathtaking view of the lush green mountains extending into the distance.
Awesome place and nice experience of Riding in the Royal Enfield. Nice view as expected but missed sunset

I missed the sunset, but had a good view of western ghats and the journey through the local bus was good as they were very cooperative, if ur going by local transport u have to request for the stop near the view point. Even seeing the monkeys over there made me happy, I wish i could visit the view again to watch sunset
Agumbe sunset point is around 75 km from Mangalore, one of the sightseeing points. Road is hilly but good.

Waaw it was a wonderful experience this Forrest feels like we are in too dense forest.  The Forrest is so cool and clean we have so many special medicine species in this Forrest.
My kind request is to those who are all going to this forest please take care of leaches.
Sincerely requesting travelers or trekkers who are exploring this forest please don't take any kind of plastic or cover. This is a very clean forest, don't spoil that natural beauty and bring a water bottle not to use and thought one.
Enjoy nature and don't take any kind from speakers into the Forrest area.

Be a good explorer and nature lover.

Save forest,
Save nature,
Save human beeing.

Thank you.
Very nice view from the top you must explore this trekking start early in the morning before sunrise 🌅

A nice drive through NH169... Really enjoyed the drive through the hairpin curves and the monkeys on both sides... The thick forests are really wonderful... Can feel the cool breeze.... It was really an good experience... The sunset veiw point and boating lake also superb
Great experience climbing the Agumbe ghat

Excellent place to stay for sometime when you wish to relax or to get to know more about wildlife and forests . The Director of ARRS Mr. Ajay Giri is a down to earth person , his sessions on ecology , wildlife, king cobra and all are just awesome.... We enjoyed the stay , food and sessions in ARRS. The best time to visit ARRS is during monsoon , snake lovers , amphibians researchers and wildlife enthusiasts will surely enjoy this place .

This temple is situated on the way to Agumbe ghat. ,Small temple on the way from Kollur to Sringeri. a calm and serene village this temple is made of laterite stone and had a warm red stone color. Shiva, Someshwara is the presiding deity.Nearby there is a Ganesh temple also.

Shri Someshwara Swami is the guardian deity of the village. Hence the village name.
Shri Someshwara Swami temple is centuries old and it is renovated in the present form.
It is a very calm and clean temple.
Nearby temples are Shri MahaGanapati temple on the same side of the road and Shri Venkataramana and Shri Hanumanta temple on the other side of the road.
When coming down from sringeri to udupi, we had pit stop for coffee. Incidentally noticed this beautiful temple.
The place Someshwara is derived from Someshwara Swami Temple.This place is located very near to agumbe ghat.
Loved style of architecture especially they use red stones for building walls and some part of floor which gives true country side ambience. Absolutely loved  the temple

places_with_reviews.name: Ancient Shri Venugopalakrishna Swamy Temple Agumbe

reviews.text: One of the famous and heritage temple in Agumbe town. The temple is known for Lord Sri Venugopala Swamy. Every year Agumbe locals will schedule fair in the temple....
A very old temple in an open space. Not many houses and people around here. There's a very old, small fort kind structure opposite this temple. Good for a few photoshoots

Every year Rathothsava will be celebrated on RathaSapthami which is usually comes during January or February. The main celebration will continue for 3 days. The temple is on the banks of the river Malapahaari.
My native
I never skip this small but beautiful temple in Agumbe. Simply awesome. Do spend some time here and find your peace of mind.
Delicious
Beautiful

places_with_reviews.name: Agumbe Ghat Hairpin curve no 2 ಆಗುಂಬೆಯ 2ನೇ ಹಿಮ್ಮುರಿ ತಿರುವು

reviews.text: Really? This is a spot to visit, I don’t think so… These are just hairpin curves in all hilly areas in the country.
Awesome
Amazing
Top
